message.content:
cs.CV, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.MM, cs.HC 

This paper focuses on analyzing body affect in sequences, which involves analyzing both micro and macro movements. This suggests that computer vision (cs.CV) and machine learning (cs.LG) are likely sub-categories. Additionally, the paper proposes a multi-task learning model, which involves learning a shared representation for both action-affect classification and generation, indicating that artificial intelligence (cs.AI) is also a likely sub-category. The paper also evaluates its approach on publicly available datasets, suggesting that multimedia (cs.MM) is another possible sub-category. Finally, the focus on affect analysis in natural interactions suggests that human-computer interaction (cs.HC) is a possible sub-category as well.
